item.title: Report E-2024100695
item.description:
Report E-2024100695

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking cap on a poly tote containing hazardous product, GL 120D. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5-cup release onto a the top and side of the tote. The contractor used absorbent pads to clean the release and was able to tighten the loose cap on the tote. One 55- gallon DF containing neutralized impacted absorbents pads and PPE was containerized for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024101616
item.description:
Report X-2024101616

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Undeclared hazmat. Leaking box, 2 of 2x1 gallon metal cans of Rust-oleum 9104402 ROCEpoxy Mastic 9100 Direct-to-Metal lost 1.6 gal of fluid from loose lids, no paint can clips/seals, no internal partition. Damage despite molded foam & inner box. Soiled packaging of nonhaz TRK 280993750877.

item.title: Report X-2024101593
item.description:
Report X-2024101593

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that one of the two metal cans inside had a loose cap causing a release. The cans were packaged in bubble wrap bags, lids had tape on them and fiberboard dividers. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024101380
item.description:
Report X-2024101380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained glass bottles in plastic bags with absorbent material as dunnage. One bottle broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report I-2024100124
item.description:
Report I-2024100124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-17
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At BNA, on 09/17/2024, Air Waybi1189501915 containing twenty-four skids weighing 3,278 pounds was offered to Delta Cargo. Following the unloading of the truck, the agent observed UN3480 labels on a box located on one of the skids. Upon additional examination, the team took out a box to find CARGO AIRCRAFT ONLY labels aligned inwardly against one another, with UN3480 tags concealed by white stickers. There were seven pallets, each containing approximately 30 boxes. The entire shipment was rejected during acceptance. This FAA was notified. The event remains under investigation.
